com.ibm.opencard.isofs
Class MFCFileParameter

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ibm.opencard.service.MFCCardServiceParameter
        |
        +--com.ibm.opencard.isofs.MFCFileParameter
Direct Known Subclasses:
MFCFileSysParameter
public class MFCFileParameter
extends MFCCardServiceParameter

Encapsulation of the constructor arguments of MFCFileAccess. The number of arguments to a card service is rather high. To simplify the construction, this object encapsulates all parameters required for the File Access service, except an optional pre-allocated channel. Every parameter can be set explicitly by a method invocation. Access to the parameters stored is provided only within this package.
The file access card service MFCFileAccess is derived from the generic card service MFCCardService. Consequently, the parameters are derived from the generic parameters, which are still required to invoke the base class constructor.

See Also:
MFCFileAccess, MFCCardServiceParameter

Constructor Detail

MFCFileParameter

public MFCFileParameter()
Creates new parameters, initialized with null. All parameters required for instantiating a MFCFileAccess, including those for the base class, must be set explicitly afterwards.
See Also:
MFCFileAccess

MFCFileParameter

public MFCFileParameter(opencard.core.service.CardServiceScheduler scheduler,
                        opencard.core.service.SmartCard smartcard,
                        boolean blocking)
Creates new parameters, the standard ones already set. In the first version of OCF, all card services had the same constructor arguments. This constructor expects exactly those arguments, and stores them. The remaining arguments required for instantiating a MFCFileAccess, including those for the base class, have to be set explicitly afterwards.
Parameters:
scheduler - where to allocate channels
smartcard - the smartcard to contact
blocking - whether channel allocation can block
See Also:
MFCFileAccess, MFCCardServiceParameter
Method Detail

setFileAccessImpl

public final void setFileAccessImpl(MFCFileAccessImpl faimpl)
Sets the file access service implementation to use. All file access services for a specific card OS version share a single file access service implementation, which is responsible for creating commands and interpreting the smartcard's responses.
Parameters:
faimpl - the file access implementation to use
